sally是什... ... Sally Lunn n. 萨利伦甜饼 sally lunn (烤好后趁热食用的)一种甜点心 sally forth 冲出,冲上前;突围,出击,出发.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French saillie, feminine past participle (used as a noun) of saillir 'come or jut out', from Old French salir 'to leap', from Latin salire
mid 17th cent. (denoting the first movement of a bell when set for ringing): perhaps from sally in the sense 'leaping motion'
late 19th cent.: dialect variant of sallow

entry.def: Sallies are clever and amusing remarks.

example.ex: He had thus far succeeded in fending off my conversational sallies.
example.tran: 他迄今为止一直不为我说的俏皮话所动。

entry.tran: 突然冲出;奋身前往;大胆迈入
entry.def: If someone sallies forth or sallies somewhere, they go out into a rather difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant situation in a brave or confident way.

example.ex: ...worrying about her when she sallies forth on her first date...
example.tran: 她第一次赴异性约会时对她的担心

example.ex: Tamara would sally out on bitterly cold nights.
example.tran: 塔玛拉会不畏严寒在夜晚外出。

means.word_mean: 2. a military action in which besieged troops burst forth from their position
3. a venture off the beaten path;

sentences.sentence: "a sally into the wide world beyond his home"
